text:
> Where does the ML fit in SciML?
ML is one of the pieces put together into the models, and in a few cases there are ways to use SciML tools to solve some ML problems, but generally SciML is a user of ML but not the other way around.

elements.text: Where does the ML fit in SciML?
ML is one of the pieces put together into the models, and in a few cases there are ways to use SciML tools to solve some ML problems, but generally SciML is a user of ML but not the other way around.

text:
How much and what sort of potential do you see for the use of more sciml by traditional ML users/tools/usecases? I think that would be cool generally but also help Julia's adoption in the ML space.

The big obvious one is neural ODEs and friends  and maybe aleatoric and epistemic uncertainty for production ML. What else?

elements.text:

text: there's some really cool stuff that I've been silent on for ICML review policy

elements.text: there's some really cool stuff that I've been silent on for ICML review policy

text: Cool. Also maybe sparse learning or pruning. Higher order optimizers
